Level A.name: Non-text Content
Level A.description: Text alternatives are provided for non-text content that provides value to the user.
Level A.example: Image of a dog with alt text; decorative image with null alt attribute.

Level A.name: Audio-only and Video-only (Pre-recorded)
Level A.description: Transcript for audio-only; transcript or audio description for video-only.

Level A.name: Audio Description or Media Alternative (Pre-recorded)
Level A.description: Transcript and/or audio descriptions for videos with audio.

Level A.name: Info and Relationships
Level A.description: Information and relationships must be perceivable by assistive tech.

Level A.name: Meaningful Sequence
Level A.description: Content reading order must be logical.
Level A.example: Step-by-step recipe accessible to screen readers.

Level A.name: Sensory Characteristics
Level A.description: Instructions must not rely solely on sensory characteristics.
Level A.example: Use of descriptive instructions over visual-only cues.

Level A.name: Use of Colour
Level A.description: Color not used as the only visual means.
Level A.example: Hyperlink has underline; graph uses patterns.

Level A.name: Audio Control
Level A.description: User must be able to stop or adjust audio playing automatically.

Level AA.name: Captions (Live)
Level AA.description: Captions for live video with audio.

Level AA.name: Audio Description (Pre-recorded)
Level AA.description: Audio description of visual content in videos.
Level AA.example: Baking video with narration of actions.

Level AA.name: Orientation
Level AA.example: Fitness app layout adapts to portrait and landscape.

Level AA.name: Identify Input Purpose
Level AA.description: Input purposes must be programmatically identifiable.
Level AA.example: Input fields labelled for assistive tools.

Level AA.name: Resize Text
Level AA.description: Text can scale to 200% without loss of function.

Level AA.name: Images of Text
Level AA.description: Use real text, not images of text unless necessary.
Level AA.example: Promo banner uses styled CSS text.

Level AA.name: Non-Text Contrast
Level AA.description: Non-text elements must meet 3:1 contrast ratio.

Level AA.name: Text Spacing
Level AA.description: Text spacing can be customized without loss.

Level AA.name: Content on Hover Focus
Level AA.description: Additional hover/focus content must be dismissible.
Level AA.example: Tooltip remains visible, dismissible by Esc.

Level AAA (Optional).name: Extended Audio Description (Pre-recorded)
Level AAA (Optional).description: Extend video duration for audio descriptions.

Level AAA (Optional).name: Media Alternative (Pre-recorded)
Level AAA (Optional).description: Text or audio alternative for media.

Level AAA (Optional).name: Audio-only (Live)
Level AAA (Optional).description: Live text or transcript for live audio.

Level AAA (Optional).name: Contrast (Enhanced)
Level AAA (Optional).description: Contrast of 7:1 for normal text and background.

Level AAA (Optional).name: Low or No Background Audio
Level AAA (Optional).description: Minimal or no background noise in audio.

Level AAA (Optional).name: Visual Presentation
Level AAA (Optional).description: Simpler layouts and enhanced visual presentation.

Level AAA (Optional).name: Images of Text (No Exception)
Level AAA (Optional).description: Never use text in images unless essential.
